meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the structure and function of the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a karyologic research on the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent2: Her karyologic knowledge helped her understand the cell nucleus better.
meanings.sent3: The karyologic investigation of the cell nucleus revealed fascinating details.
meanings.sent4: His karyologic expertise shone light on the mysteries of the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent5: Through karyologic studies, we delve deep into the secrets of the cell nucleus.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the analysis of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: The karyologic examination focused on the chromosomes' structure.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use karyologic techniques to analyze chromosomes.
meanings.sent3: The karyologic approach to chromosomes uncovered surprising facts.
meanings.sent4: Her karyologic skills in chromosome analysis were unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The karyologic study of chromosomes revolutionized genetic research.

meanings.definition: Involving the examination of genetic material within a cell.
meanings.sent1: The karyologic study revealed insights into genetic material within cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on karyologic methods to explore cell genetic material.
meanings.sent3: The karyologic investigation of cell genetic material was enlightening.
meanings.sent4: His karyologic research on cell genetic material was groundbreaking.
meanings.sent5: Through karyologic analysis, we understand the complexity of cell genetic material.
